title: Animal Magnetism
reward: Ava's attractor if your Ranged level is less than 50, or Ava's accumulator if your Ranged level is 50 or higher
The ability to trade with Ava and purchase her devices

title: Another Slice of H.A.M.
reward: The ability to buy Goblin Village teleport spheres
Free access to the Dorgesh-Kaan–Keldagrim train system

title: A Kingdom Divided
reward: An antique lamp giving 10,000 experience to any skill level 40 or above.
Ability to set your respawn point to Kourend Castle. Talk to Asteros Arceuus, now found on the 1st floor[UK] of Kourend Castle, to change your respawn point at any time.

24 new spells made available in the Arceuus spellbook (all combat spells with the exception of Ghostly Grasp and Inferior Demonbane, and all utility spells with the exception of Resurrect Crops and reanimation spells).

title: A Night at the Theatre
reward: Three antique lamps giving 20,000 experience to any combat skill level 50 or above, excluding Prayer.

title: A Porcine of Interest
reward: Access to the Sourhog Cave and Sourhog slayer tasks from Spria or Turael.
Existing slayer helmets will have reinforced goggles added to them.

title: A Soul's Bane
reward: Access to the Dungeon of Tolna

title: A Tail of Two Cats
reward: A Doctor's hat or Nurse hat (you can switch by destroying your hat and requesting a new one from the Apothecary)

Two antique lamps worth 2,500 experience each in skills of your choice over 30
A Mouse toy (can be used to play with your cat, and functions as a fun weapon at the Duel Arena)
Completing this quest awards the player with 5 Kudos which can be claimed by talking to Historian Minas in the Varrock Museum.

title: A Taste of Hope
reward: Ivandis flail - A weapon that can damage the vyrewatch
Drakan's medallion - An amulet that gives the player unlimited teleports to the Theatre of Blood
Tome of experience, granting 2,500 experience to any three skills of the player's choosing (level 35 or over). Can be the same skill.

title: Below Ice Mountain
reward:
2,000 coins
Access to the Ruins of Camdozaal
Flex emote
The ability to make a steak sandwich

title: Beneath Cursed Sands
reward:
20,000 Agility experience
Access to the Tombs of Amascut
A Keris partisan
The ability to upgrade the Keris to the Keris partisan
The circlet of water, an untradeable helm that acts like a waterskin when worn
Access to a fairy ring on a small island south-west of Necropolis, code a k p. (Unlocked when entering Necropolis during the beginning of the quest.)
Jaltevas teleport option on the Pharaoh's sceptre. Unlocked by selecting Commune on an obelisk in the Necropolis area.

title: Between a Rock...
required-skills: Level 40 Mining (higher mining being an advantage)
ability to defeat at least a level 75 enemy.
reward: The ability to teleport to Dondakan's rock using a ring of wealth

You get to keep your gold helmet and can continue using it to fire yourself into the rock to access the Arzinian Mine where there are lots of gold rocks and gold veins, and a nearby dwarf banks the player's gold ore for a charge (he keeps 20% of the ores, rounded up, or 10% of the ores if the player has the ring of charos (a)).

title: Big Chompy Bird Hunting
reward: The ability to fletch ogre arrows
The ability to cook chompy birds and earn a bowman hat

title: Biohazard
reward: Use of the Combat Training Camp north of the city. Players can attack a total of six training dummies in the camp for 50 attack experience each.
The ability to travel freely through the West Ardougne gate.
The ability to use the West Ardougne Teleport in the Arceuus spellbook and teletab.

title: Bone Voyage
reward: Access to Fossil Island - to disembark the boat upon arrival at Fossil Island, speak to the Junior Navigator.

title: Cabin Fever
reward: 10,000 coins (only if you speak to Bill Teach after the quest)
Ability to play the Trouble Brewing minigame

title: Client of Kourend
reward: Two antique lamps which provide 500 XP each in a skill of the player's choosing.
Kourend favour certificate. Reading it grants 20% favour towards a city of your choosing.
A good choice for the favour reward (if not at 30% already) is Port Piscarilius since the first 30% is both semi-expensive, and time consuming.

title: Cold War
reward: The ability to make the penguin suit. To enter the suit again, you must talk to Larry again at the zoo, pier, Iceberg, or Lumbridge sheep pen.
The ability to use the Penguin agility course
Players can also steal more cowbells and make more bongos. The cowbells or the bongos can only be played in a penguin suit.

title: Contact!
reward: Combat lamp giving two wishes granting 7,000 experience to Attack, Strength, Defence, Hitpoints, Ranged, or Magic
The music track Back to Life

title: Creature of Fenkenstrain
required-skills: ability to defeat lvl 51 monster and run past level 72 monsters
reward: The Ring of charos, which allows access to the Werewolf Agility Course, and, when activated during Garden of Tranquillity, reduced cost to many transport links.

title: Demon Slayer
reward: Completing this quest awards the player with 5 Kudos which can be claimed by talking to Historian Minas in the Varrock Museum

title: Darkness of Hallowvale
required-skills: The ability to withstand several melee attacks from a level 169 enemy.
reward: Tome of experience, granting 2,000 experience to any three skills of the player's choosing (level 30 or over). Can be the same skill.

title: Death Plateau
reward: Ability to purchase and wear climbing boots from Tenzing

title: Death to the Dorgeshuun
required-skills: The ability to defeat a level 50 enemy with Melee or Magic.
reward: You are granted access to the Dorgeshuun city!
Access to the H.A.M. Store room, where you can loot gems, jewellery, and coins from chests.
Access to the water wheel tunnel (Dartog will appear there, and you'll be able to travel between the Lumbridge Castle cellar, the Dorgeshuun Mines and the water wheel tunnel at will).
Ability to use the bone dagger and Dorgeshuun crossbow special attacks.
Access to Dorgesh-Kaan, the Dorgeshuun city
A torch if you did not have a light source in your inventory at the end of the quest.

title: Desert Treasure
required-skills: 43 prayer is required especially for pure
reward: The ability to use Ancient Magicks: At any time, you can pray at the altar and change between the standard and Ancient Magicks spellbooks. After traversing the pyramid for the first time, you may enter via the back-door of the pyramid to gain a short cut to the altar. Be warned that changing spellbooks will drain your prayer to 0.
Ring of visibility: If you ever lose it, you can obtain another one from Rasolo.
Access to the Curse of the Empty Lord miniquest (only requires the ring of visibility).

Access to ancient staff: You can also buy one from Eblis for 80,000 coins. If you lose the staff, you will have to kill mummies inside the pyramid, or buy it from other players. It can also be obtained as a rare drop from the Chaos Fanatic, as a rare drop from the Thermonuclear smoke devil or as an uncommon drop from Vet'ion.
Access to the Smoke Dungeon, which can be used for various Slayer tasks.
Ability to talk to Eblis to obtain an ancient signet.

title: Dragon Slayer II
required-skills: and 50 Hitpoints. Note that all skills are no boosts allowed.
reward: Ability to speak to cats without the Catspeak amulet.
Ability to make Super antifire potions by speaking to Primula.
4x 25,000 experience in Magic, Ranged, Strength, Attack, Defence or Hitpoints by speaking to Ellen.
Access to Fountain of Uhld where dragonstone jewellery (excluding the ring of wealth) can be recharged.
Access to the Pool of Dreams where players can refight Galvek or rewatch cutscenes from the quest.
Access the shop to buy the Mythical cape.

Access to the pettable dog.
Access to adamant and rune dragons in the Lithkren Vault.
Access to a stronger version of Vorkath on Ungael.
Ability to reforge the dragon platebody and kiteshield.
Ability to have a rune dragon as a Treasure Room guardian (requiring 99 Construction and 25,000,000 coins).
Ability to create Ava's assembler by bringing Vorkath's head, 75 Mithril arrows, and 4,999 gp (or Ava's accumulator) to Ava in Draynor Manor.
Ability to craft Ferocious gloves from Hydra leather in the Lithkren Vault (requires a hammer).
Ability to construct Mythical cape (mounted) in your POH.
Ability to go back through the grandiose doors on Lithkren and use your Digsite pendant on the Strange Machine north of the dragons. This will allow you to teleport there.

title: Dream Mentor
required-skills: The ability to defeat 4 powerful monsters without the use of prayer.
reward: 7 new spells added to your Lunar spells book (Monster Examine, Humidify, Hunter Kit, Stat Spy, Dream, Plank Make, Spellbook Swap).
A dreamy lamp, which awards 15,000 experience in a combat skill of a player's choosing, apart from Attack and Prayer.
'Birds-Eye' Jack will now allow you to use the bank without a seal of passage equipped or in your inventory.

title: Dwarf Cannon
reward: The ability to buy and use a dwarf multicannon

title: Eadgar's Ruse
reward: The ability to grow and steal Goutweed, which can be traded with Sanfew for herbs.
The ability to use the Trollheim Teleport spell.
The ability to use a Scroll of redirection to redirect a Teleport to house tablet to Trollheim.

title: Eagles' Peak
reward: Access to the Eagle transport system.
Captured ferrets can be used to flush rabbits from their holes, allowing them to be caught in rabbit snares.

title: Elemental Workshop I
required-skills: Level 20 Mining (30 if you want to mine your own coal)
reward: An elemental shield, as well as the ability to make and wield them.

title: Elemental Workshop II
reward: The ability to make and use elemental mind equipment.

title: Enakhra's Lament
reward: Camulet, which allows you to talk to camels and teleport to the temple four times. It can be recharged by using camel dung on it. You can pay Lazim 1 million gold pieces to give it unlimited charges.
Camel mask (Use a piece of soft clay on the pedestal with the globes on it to make.)

title: Enlightened Journey
reward: Gnome goggles from the Gnome Restaurant minigame can be combined with the bomber cap by talking with Auguste.
Access to the balloon transport system.

title: Fairytale I - Growing Pains
required-skills: The ability to defeat a level 111 Tanglefoot with limited weaponry.
reward: Magic secateurs (increases crop harvests by 10% when Farming)

title: Fairytale II - Cure a Queen
reward: An antique lamp granting 2,500 experience in any skill over level 30
Access to the fairy rings network
Access to Fairy Fixit's Fairy Enchantment shop

title: Family Crest
reward: Cooking gauntlets (Caleb): Reduces the chance of burning certain fish significantly: (lobsters, swordfish, monkfish, sharks and anglerfish).
Goldsmith gauntlets (Avan): Increases the Smithing experience from smelting gold by 150% - from 22.5 to 56.2.

Chaos gauntlets (Johnathon): Increases the damage done by bolt (chaos rune) spells by 3. Stacks multiplicatively with the Tome of Fire and Slayer helmet (i), the former having a moderate upkeep cost, for a maximum hit of 25, which is by far the highest damage per second for a beginner.
After the Family Pest miniquest, you can have all three gauntlets for 500,000 coins.

title: Fight Arena
required-skills: Be able to kill level 112 and 137 monsters

title: Fishing Contest
reward: Access to the underground White Wolf Mountain passage.
Ability to catch minnows in the Fishing Guild with 82 Fishing and a full Angler's outfit.

title: Garden of Tranquillity
reward: An activated ring of charos - players can wear the activated ring to charm various NPCs to pay less for certain services, or get choices that are otherwise unavailable.
4-dose compost potion, can be used on a full compost bin to turn compost into supercompost.
After the quest, the player can visit the garden and pick 4 fruits from the white tree. They regrow after some time, similar to other fruit bearing trees. Each fruit restores about 8% of energy.

title: Gertrude's Cat
reward: Gertrude will now sell kittens for you to raise for 100 coins each.

title: Getting Ahead
reward: 3,000 coins - If not claimed at quest completion due to no available inventory space, talk to Gordon again after the quest for the reward.
Access to a tannery in the Kebos Lowlands (speak to Mary to access tanning services).

title: Ghosts Ahoy
reward: The Ectophial, which allows direct teleport to the Ectofuntus, is refilled from the Ectofuntus. (must have obtained ghostspeak amulet)

title: Grim Tales
required-skills: Ability to defeat a level 138 cloud giant - Glod.
reward: Dwarven helmet (equip this helmet in the Dwarven Mines to complete a Hard Falador task)

title: Haunted Mine
required-skills: The ability to defeat a level 95 enemy.
reward: The ability to make the Salve amulet, which when equipped gives combat bonuses against undead monsters.
Access to a shortcut to the crystal outcrops.

title: Hazeel Cult
reward: 2000 coins (plus 5 from the fake ending if you sided with the Carnillean family)
Hazeel's mark (if you sided with Hazeel)
Carnillean armour (if you sided with Ceril and obtained an extra during the quest)
5 Kudos, which can be claimed by talking to Historian Minas in the Varrock Museum.

title: Heroes' Quest
required-skills: 50 Mining (49 if you use dwarven stout)
reward: The ability to purchase and wield dragon battleaxes and maces.
Ability to utilise the Fountain of Rune.
Ability to use Charge dragonstone jewellery scrolls.
Access to the Fountain of Heroes, where players can recharge their amulets of glory.

title: Holy Grail
reward: Ability to put King Arthur picture on the wall in the Construction skill.

title: Horror from the Deep
required-skills: The ability to kill a level 100 monster.
reward:
A damaged book of your choice which, when complete, will become: a Holy book (Saradomin), an Unholy book (Zamorak), or a Book of balance (Guthix).
Since 3 March 2016, it is possible to purchase all the damaged books from Jossik for 5,000 coins each, even if you have not filled your other book(s).

Access to the Lighthouse general store and the Dagannoth caves underneath. (There are level 74 and 92 dagannoth. Both use a Ranged attack that has low accuracy, but the level 92 ones will try to use their much more effective Melee attack whenever they can.)

title: Icthlarin's Little Helper
required-skills: Be able to defeat a level 91 monster.
reward: Access to the city of Sophanem.
Unlock the carpet rides from Pollnivneach to Sophanem and Menaphos.

title: In Aid of the Myreque
reward: Access to the Temple Trekking minigame.
The ability to make the Rod of Ivandis.
Completing this quest awards the player with 5 Kudos which can be claimed by talking to Historian Minas in the Varrock Museum.

title: In Search of the Myreque
required-skills: The ability to defeat a level 97 skeleton dog.

title: King's Ransom
reward: Antique lamp granting 5,000 experience to any skill level 50 or above.
Access to the Knight Waves Training Grounds.
The ability to use the Chivalry and Piety prayers, with level 60 and 70 Prayer, respectively, after completion of Knight Waves Training Grounds.

title: Land of the Goblins
reward:
8,000 Agility experience
8,000 Fishing experience
8,000 Thieving experience
8,000 Herblore experience
Access to the Goblin Temple (with an altar to recharge prayer points).
Access to Yu'biusk, using fairy ring code blq.
Ability to purchase Plain of mud spheres that transports you to the Goblin Cave.
Ability to make goblin potions.

title: Legends' Quest
reward: Access to the Legends' Guild (including shop to buy the cape of legends).
The ability to wield the dragon sq shield.

7,650 experience each in four skills of your choice (limited to Attack, Defence, Strength, Hitpoints, Prayer, Magic, Woodcutting, Crafting, Smithing, Herblore, Agility, Thieving. It is possible to choose the same skill several times).
The ability to charge your Skills necklace or Combat bracelet at the Legends' Guild or the Fountain of Rune.
Access to the Kharazi Jungle and a vine shortcut into it, requiring 79 Agility.
Radimus Erkle will provide replacement dark daggers, which can be investigated via right-click to switch appearance between a dark or glowing dagger.

title: Lost City
required-skills: The ability to kill a level 101 Tree Spirit without weapons.
reward: Ability to buy and wield dragon longswords and dragon daggers (with level 60 Attack).
Ability to make Cosmic runes with the Runecraft skill.

title: Lunar Diplomacy
reward: Access to Lunar Isle and Lunar equipment.

title: Making Friends with My Arm
required-skills: Level 68 Agility (Higher Agility level is recommended.)
reward: A new disease-free herb patch in Weiss (requires building the fire of nourishment before use).
Ability to direct a teleport room portal to Troll Stronghold with a combination of salt.

title: Making History
reward: Enchanted key, allowing you to go on your own treasure digs until it disappears.
Access to the museum in the outpost.
Ability to complete master clue hot/cold Treasure Trails.
Ability to claim 5 Kudos and an antique lamp for 1,000 experience (in any skill over level 20) by talking to Historian Minas in the Varrock Museum.

title: Merlin's Crystal
reward: Completing this quest awards the player with 5 Kudos which can be claimed by talking to Historian Minas in the Varrock Museum.

title: Monk's Friend
reward:
2,000 Woodcutting experience
8 Law runes
Brother Omad will throw parties for you by speaking to him.

title: Monkey Madness I
required-skills: None but a Prayer level 43 is highly recommended (especially for pures). The ability to defeat a Level 195 Demon (ranging is better for fighting).
reward: Speaking to Daero after the quest gives the choice of either, 35,000 experience in Attack and Defence and 20,000 experience in Strength and Hitpoints OR 35,000 experience in Strength and Hitpoints and 20,000 experience in Attack and Defence. Returning to Ape Atoll after completing the quest requires undergoing Daero's training.
The ability to buy and wield the Dragon scimitar.
The ability to turn into a monkey in Ape Atoll & Ardougne Zoo, using the Monkey greegree.
Full access to Ape Atoll. (Bank is unlocked after Monkey Madness II.)

title: Monkey Madness II
required-quests: Enlightened Journey (you must unlock the grand tree destination for Balloon transport system and level 60 firemaking is a requirement)
reward: Access to the Crash Site Cavern containing Demonic Gorillas.
The ability to communicate with monkeys without the monkeyspeak amulet.
All NPCs on the surface of Ape Atoll will be non-aggressive without requiring the use of Monkey greegrees.
Access to Ape Atoll bank and Oobapohk's Javelin Store.
Access to new glider spot directly to Ape Atoll.

2x 50,000 experience rewards from Duke in your choice of Magic, Ranged, Attack, Defence, Strength, or Hitpoints. Found on the hill east of the main gate of Ape Atoll. (Walk-up west hill, and climb the ladder to reach the east hill.)
Ability to wield the Heavy ballista.
A Royal seed pod, which provides unlimited teleports to the Grand Tree (up to level 30 Wilderness).
A Monkey can be found in one of the crates at the Crash Site. It is purely cosmetic and can be equipped in the cape slot.
Bobawu will now track your laps of the Ape Atoll Agility Course, with you being able to transform your monkey into other variants upon completing several laps.
The ability to re-fight Glough by gazing into the Burning brazier in Zooknock's house.
The ability to reclaim lost Greegrees from Zooknock in his Gnome Stronghold house (no supplies required).
Access to a new maniacal monkey hunting area where Glough's laboratory used to be in Kruk's Dungeon.
Various dragons will now drop dragon javelin heads.

title: Mountain Daughter
required-skills: The ability to defeat a level 70 monster.
reward: The ability to pass into the Mountain Camp over the rockslide.

title: Mourning's End Part I
reward: Access to the Mourner HQ basement and the village of Lletya.

title: Mourning's End Part II
reward: A crystal trinket, which allows you to enter the Temple of Light again after the quest.
A death talisman, and the ability to craft death runes (you'll get full access to the abyssal rift as well).

title: My Arm's Big Adventure
reward: Access to a disease-free herb patch on top of the Troll Stronghold. This patch does not allow growing of regular Goutweed.

title: Nature Spirit
reward: Access to Mort Myre Swamp and the Nature Spirit altar, where you can replenish and temporarily boost your prayer points by 2.
3 meat pies and 3 apple pies unless they were rotted by the ghasts.
Ability to build Fire of Dehumidification after completion of Making Friends with My Arm.

title: Observatory Quest
reward: Your item reward depends on what astrological sign you see when you look through the telescope. It is different for each person. Each one rewards an uncut sapphire as well as the following:

Aquarius: 25 water runes
Aries: 875 Attack experience
Cancer: An amulet of defence
Capricorn: 875 Strength experience
Gemini: A black 2h sword
Leo: 875 Hitpoints experience
Libra: 3 law runes
Pisces: 3 tuna
Sagittarius: A maple longbow
Scorpio: Weapon poison
Taurus: A 1-dose super strength potion
Virgo: 875 Defence experience
The Spirit of Scorpius will now give you a mould to make unholy symbols, and he will bless them for you too. He can be found in the graveyard north of the Observatory.
Talk to the Observatory assistant after the quest and he will reward you with a jug of wine as well as tell you his and the professor's real name.
Access to the grappling shortcut rock outside the Observatory.
Completing this quest awards the player with 5 Kudos which can be claimed by talking to Historian Minas in the Varrock Museum.

title: Olaf's Quest
required-skills: The ability to defeat a level 100 monster.
reward: Access to a cave where you can fight brine rats.
A piece of parchment telling you of other shipwrecks with more treasure. (This extra treasure is currently not available in the game)

title: One Small Favour
reward: Two experience lamps giving 10,000 experience to any skill of your choice. Skill must be at least level 30.
The ability to make Guthix rest tea.
The ability to craft pot lids.
Access to the gnome glider route to the Feldip Hills.

title: Pirate's Treasure
reward: Ability to use the pay-fare option to and from Karamja.
Access to One-Eyed Hector's Treasure Chest (contains a gold ring, an emerald, and 450 coins).

title: Prince Ali Rescue
reward: Free passage through the Lumbridge - Al Kharid toll gate from now on.
(Members) Access to the Sorceress's Garden Thieving minigame.

title: Plague City
reward: Ardougne teleport scroll, reading it unlocks the Ardougne Teleport with 51 Magic and use of the Ardougne teletab.

title: Priest in Peril
reward: Wolfbane dagger, prevents the citizens of Canifis from transforming into werewolves when attacked.
Completing this quest awards the player with 5 Kudos which can be claimed by talking to Historian Minas in the Varrock Museum.

title: Rune Mysteries
reward: The ability to mine rune essence.
The ability to use lamps and books of knowledge from random events on Runecraft.
Completing this quest awards the player with 5 Kudos which can be claimed by talking to Historian Minas in the Varrock Museum.

title: Rag and Bone Man II
required-skills: Level 20 Defence (and you must have done the little Mogre mini-quest to have access to fighting the mogres). Also
you must have the ability to kill monsters that are up to level 88.

title: Ratcatchers
required-quests: The Giant Dwarf started to access to Keldagrim
reward: The ability to train overgrown cats into wily and lazy cats.
The ability to name your wily or lazy cat (up to six letters long).
The ability to use the Grouping teleport to the rat pits in Port Sarim, Ardougne, Varrock, and Keldagrim.

title: Recipe for Disaster (Complete All Chapters)
required-quests: Started Legends' Quest up until  gaining access to the Kharazi Jungle.
reward: In total, completing all 10 subquests for "Recipe for Disaster" awards:
An experience lamp, which grants 20,000 experience to any skill above 50 (can be banked for later use)
Access to the following areas: Mogre Camp, Evil Chicken's Lair.
Ability to add coloured spices to stews of any sort.
Ability to use the boat trip to travel between Karamja and Feldip Hills.
Access to the banking chest (under Lumbridge Castle).
Access to a food store in the Chest.

title: Recipe for Disaster - Starting Out
reward: The invitation to the feast of a lifetime!
Access to the Culinaromancer's Chest (after watching the cut scene in the feast room).

title: Recipe for Disaster - Subquest I: The Mountain Dwarf
reward: Further access to the Culinaromancer's Chest

title: Recipe for Disaster - Subquest II: Pirate Pete
reward: The ability to go diving and fight crabs (you need your diving apparatus)
The ability to cook crab meat (heals 10 hitpoints in 5 bites)
The ability to kill crabs to get their shells and claws, which can be made into a helmet and gloves with a chisel
Further access to the Culinaromancer's Chest

title: Recipe for Disaster - Subquest III: Goblin Generals
reward: Further access to the Culinaromancer's Chest.

title: Recipe for Disaster - Subquest IV: Skrach Uglogwee
reward: The ability to use the boat trip to travel between Karamja and the Feldip Hills (you must pay a fee of chompies or exotic herbs).
Further access to the Culinaromancer's Chest.

title: Recipe for Disaster - Subquest V: Lumbridge Guide
reward: Further access to the Culinaromancer's Chest.

title: Recipe for Disaster - Subquest VI: Evil Dave
reward: The ability to catch hellrats to get a Hellcat.
The ability to have your cat fight Hell-Rat Behemoths.
The ability to add coloured spices to stew by catching hellrats (Spicy stews can boost and lower certain stats).
Further access to the Culinaromancer's Chest.

title: Recipe for Disaster - Subquest VII: Sir Amik Varze
required-quests: Started Legends' Quest up until  gaining access to the Kharazi Jungle.
required-skills: The ability to defeat a level 227 Black dragon (Can be safespotted.).
reward: Access to the Evil Chicken's Lair, where you can fight black dragons.
Further access to the Culinaromancer's Chest.

title: Recipe for Disaster - Subquest VIII: King Awowogei
required-skills: The ability to defeat a level 84 Big Snake.
reward: Further access to the Culinaromancer's Chest.

title: Recipe for Disaster - Defeating the Culinaromancer
required-quests: Recipe for Disaster - Subquest I: The Mountain Dwarf
Recipe for Disaster - Subquest II: Pirate Pete
Recipe for Disaster - Subquest III: Goblin Generals
Recipe for Disaster - Subquest IV: Skrach Uglogwee
Recipe for Disaster - Subquest V: Lumbridge Guide
Recipe for Disaster - Subquest VI: Evil Dave
Recipe for Disaster - Subquest VII: Sir Amik Varze
Recipe for Disaster - Subquest VIII: King Awowogei
required-skills: None but higher combat lelve is recommended for defeat all enemies without Prayer.
reward: An experience lamp, which grants 20,000 experience to any skill above 50 (can be banked for later use)
Full access to the Culinaromancer's Chest.

title: Recruitment Drive
required-skills: None but be able to defeat a Level 20 without any equipment or items.
reward: Access to initiate armour. You will be given a sallet for free, and you can buy subsequent sallets from Sir Tiffy Cashien for 6,000 coins, the cuisse for 8,000 coins, the hauberk for 10,000 coins, or the full set for 20,000 coins. It is aesthetically similar to white armour, with a gold trim.
The Gaze of Saradomin - When you die, you will have the option of returning to Falador instead of Lumbridge. Talk to Sir Tiffy Cashien to change your spawn point at any time.
If you were a male at the start of the quest, you'll be given your 3,000 coins back, as well as a free Makeover voucher to change back.

title: Regicide
required-skills: The ability to defeat a level 110 Tyras guard (can be safespotted).
reward: Access to the elven kingdom of Tirannwn and the overpass of Arandar.
The ability to wield the dragon halberd (With level 60 Attack and 30 Strength).
The ability to charter a ship to Port Tyras.
The ability to use Iorwerth camp teleport scrolls.
The ability to use Zul-Andra teleport scrolls and battle Zulrah

title: Roving Elves
required-skills: Must be able to defeat a level 84 without weapons
reward: Crystal shield or bow with 500 charges

title: Rum Deal
reward: The Holy wrench (while in your inventory, this grants more prayer points when drinking a prayer potion)

title: Shield of Arrav
reward: Additional rewards when talking with Historian Minas in the Varrock Museum: 5 Kudos, Antique lamp awarding 1,000xp in a skill of at least level 20.

title: Sleeping Giants
reward:
6,000 Smithing experience
Access to the Giants' Foundry minigame

title: Secrets of the North
reward: Access to a stronger version of the Strange Creature, the Phantom Muspah

title: Scorpion Catcher
required-skills: The ability to run past level 172 black demons and level 64 poison spiders.
reward: The ability to have Thormac turn a battlestaff into a mystic staff for 40,000 coins.

title: Sea Slug
reward:
7,175 Fishing experience
Access to the Fishing Platform
Oyster pearls

title: Shades of Mort'ton
required-skills: The ability to defeat 5 level 40 Loar Shades.
reward: Ability to play the Shades of Mort'ton minigame.
Ability to use the Shades of Mort'ton minigame teleport.
Bonus: If you take the Diary of Herbi Flax to the Apothecary in Varrock, you'll get an extra 335 Herblore experience (can only be done once).

title: Shadow of the Storm
required-skills: The ability to defeat a level 100 demon.
reward: 10,000 experience in any combat skill other than Prayer.
Silverlight turns into the Darklight sword - it has a special attack and is even more powerful against demons. It costs slightly more to replace.
Six cut gems: two sapphires, two rubies and two emeralds, if you use a hammer and chisel on the demon's throne and had not yet removed them during The Golem.

title: Shilo Village
reward: Ability to quick travel to Shilo Village using the cart near the Brimhaven docks.

After completing the quest, you can sell every item you obtained during the quest to Yanni Salika in Shilo Village for 2,000 - 100 each for the stone-plaque, tattered scroll, crumpled scroll, Bervirius notes and the bone key, 500 for the locating crystal, and 1000 for the beads of the dead.
Ability to mine the gem rocks in Shilo Village mine.

title: Sins of the Father
reward: Access to the Daeyalt Essence Mine
A tome of experience, granting 15,000 experience to any skill. (level 60 or higher). This reward can be utilised three times and may be used for the same skill.
Boat travel between Burgh de Rott, Slepe and the Icyene Graveyard

title: Song of the Elves
required-skills: 75 Magic to wield the Trident of the swamp in the final fight is recommended.
reward: Ability to change respawn point to Prifddinas
Ability to move Player Owned House to Prifddinas
Ability to teleport to Prifddinas with a teleport crystal
Ability to make crystal tools, armour and weaponry

title: Spirits of the Elid
reward: Access to Nardah's fountain for water and the shrine: Praying at the statuette will fill your Hitpoints, temporarily boost it, cure poison and venom, restore your prayer points, restore your run energy and your special attack.

title: Swan Song
reward: Access to the Piscatoris Fishing Colony
The ability to use Skeleton Mages for training
Access to the following items from Malignius Mortifer upon request: A brown apron, Bone seeds (requires an airtight pot)

title: The Restless Ghost
reward: Ghostspeak amulet (keep for Creature of Fenkenstrain)

title: The Ascent of Arceuus
reward: Arceuus favour certificate. Reading it grants 10% Arceuus favour.
A page for Kharedst's memoirs, 'A dark disposition.' It teleports players to the centre of Arceuus.

title: Temple of the Eye
reward:
5,000 Runecrafting experience
An additional 4,210 Runecraft XP is gained during the quest, for a total of 9,210 XP
Access to the Guardians of the Rift minigame
A medium pouch (if not already obtained)

title: The Depths of Despair
reward: Hosidius favour certificate. Reading it grants 10% Hosidius favour.
A page for Kharedst's memoirs, 'Lunch by the lancalliums'. It teleports players to just east of the Hosidius Kitchen.

title: The Dig Site
reward: Show the museum curator the Level 3 certificate to choose between something to drink (Fruit blast) or something to eat (chocolate cake). Get the cake for Desert Treasure or the fruit blast for recipe for disaster. Make sure that you go through the dialogue for each one that you give it or he will not give you a chance to pick which reward you want and you will receive nothing.
The ability to do Varrock Museum specimen cleaning to obtain a Digsite pendant.
The Ancient talisman can be viewed in the Digsite Exhibit at the museum on the ground floor.
Previously granted the ability to choose the book of darkness after completion of Horror from the Deep.

title: The Eyes of Glouphrie
reward:
A crystal saw seed — Either take it to Ilfeen in Tirannwn or use it on the singing bowl by Brimstail to get an enchanted crystal
saw. It allows items (that require a saw) to be made three levels above your Construction. It has a limited number of charges (28), but the recharge is free - use the bowl again.
Using the crystal seed with the singing bowl and getting a crystal saw is a medium task in the Western Provinces Area Achievement Diary.

title: The Feud
reward: A willow blackjack (as a drop from the tough guy)
An adamant scimitar (as a drop from the bandit champion)
Access to the Rogue Trader minigame – Completing this will allow Ali Morrisane to sell blackjacks, various runes, and different clothing from around the Kharidian Desert.
Can now steal from villagers, bandits and Menaphite Thugs.

title: The Forsaken Tower
reward: Lovakengj favour certificate. Reading it grants 10% Lovakengj favour.
A page for Kharedst's memoirs, 'Jewellery of jubilation.' It teleports players north-east of the bank in Lovakengj.

title: The Fremennik Exiles
reward: Access to the Island of Stone
Ability to kill a Basilisk Knight as a Slayer Task.
A Fremennik honorific, Dräpare, added to the player's Fremennik name.
Ability to create and equip the Neitiznot faceguard.

title: The Fremennik Isles
reward: Two lots of Combat level 10,000 Combat experience (choose between Strength Strength, Attack Attack, Defence Defence or Hitpoints Hitpoints).

A Fremennik royal helm known as the helm of neitiznot, which is the equivalent of a berserker helm with a +3 Prayer bonus, slightly better Magic and crush Defence, and no negative bonuses. If a player loses the helm, they can talk to Mawnis Burowgar to buy another one for 50,000 coins.
Access to an island with a runite rock north-east of Neitiznot, which also has seven (7) coal rocks nearby.
Access to the Jatizso mine, which contains up to adamantite rocks.
Around 20,000 coins in assorted rewards during quest.
The banks in Neitiznot and Jatizso are close to water, range, furnace, fishing spots, mining ores; a spinning wheel is also nearby.
If the jester outfit is lost, a player can retrieve another one from the chest behind King Gjuki Sorvott IV's throne.
Learn the ability to create yak-hide armour and Neitiznot shields.
The Contraband Yak Produce shop is available on Jatizso if a player refunds the 5,000 coin tax to Vanligga Gastfrihet, who is north of the king.

title: The Fremennik Trials
reward: Access to the islands of Miscellania, Etceteria, Neitiznot, and Jatizso along with access to the facilities in Rellekka.
Ability to wear the Fremennik warrior, berserker, archer, and farseer helms.
Ability to have Fossegrimen create the enchanted lyre(i).
Jarvald will charge no fee for travelling to Waterbirth Island.

title: The Golem
reward: 2 cut rubies, emeralds, and sapphires (collect these by using a chisel and hammer on the throne)
Unlock the carpet ride from Shantay Pass to Uzer.
Black Mushroom Ink (Made during Quest, used to paint desert clothing black for Shadow of the Storm)

title: The Grand Tree
required-skills: The ability to defeat a level 172 Black demon (safespottable for Ranged and Magic or melee using a halberd).
reward: Access to the mine under the Grand Tree.
Access to the Gnome glider transportation system.
Ability to use the Agility shortcut from the Grand Tree to the Barbarian Outpost (with 37 Agility).
Ability to use the Spirit Tree in the Stronghold after the completion of Tree Gnome Village.
Completing this quest awards the player with 5 Kudos which can be claimed by talking to Historian Minas in the Varrock Museum.

title: The Great Brain Robbery
reward: Blessed lamp (Skills 5,000 experience in a chosen skill above level 30 and can be placed in your bank).

Barrelchest anchor (To repair your barrelchest anchor, return to Mos Le'Harmless and make sure you have a book o' piracy in your inventory; then, go to the docks south of the bank and talk to "Smith." He can fix your anchor for 230,000 coins.)

title: The Hand in the Sand
reward: Ability to buy pink dye from Betty.

A secret reward from Bert - He simply loves sand, and wasn't in the job for the money. He will ship 84 buckets of sand to your bank if you talk to him after the quest. This can be done once per day (UTC). Asking Bert to take sand to your bank is also an Ardougne Medium task.
Access to the Wizards' Guild rune store.

title: The Lost Tribe
reward: The ability to use the Goblin Bow and Goblin Salute emotes.
Access to Nardok's Bone Weapon's store where players can purchase the Dorgeshuun crossbow, Bone bolts and other bone weapons.

title: The Queen of Thieves
reward: Piscarilius favour certificate. Reading it grants 10% Piscarilius favour.
A page for Kharedst's memoirs, 'The fisher's flute.' It teleports players to the centre of Port Piscarilius.

title: The Slug Menace
reward: Promotion to Proselyte among the Temple Knights. This means you can buy and wear Proselyte armour with a greater Prayer bonus than Initiate. You can buy each piece individually, or buy the armour pack which, when opened, gives you the plate, helm, and legs/tassets all at once. The pack costs 25,000 coins.

Buying the upgraded armour in separate pieces cost more: the helm costs 8,000 coins, the platelegs and plateskirt cost 10,000 coins, and the platebody costs 12,000 coins for a total of 30,000 coins. Required for the Falador Hard Diary.

title: Tai Bwo Wannai Trio
required-skills: Level 5 Fishing (Level 65 Fishing if you want to catch and cook your own Karambwan
reward: A karambwan-poisoned rune spear from talking to Tamayu in the village after the quest. Note: you will also receive combat experience.
Access to Tamayu's Spear Stall (sells cleaning cloths).
Access to Tiadeche's Karambwan Stall (sells raw karambwans and karambwan vessels).
The ability to pray at the newly repaired tribal statue (works like an altar) from talking to Tinsay and Tiadeche in the village after the quest.
The ability to catch and cook karambwans from talking to Tinsay in the village after the quest.
The ability to fight the Shaikahan (level 83 - you need a kp spear to hit it).
The ability to use Tai bwo wannai teleport scrolls.
You can also take part in the Smithing section of Otto's Barbarian Training.

title: Tale of the Righteous
reward: Shayzien favour certificate. Reading it grants 10% Shayzien favour.
A page for Kharedst's memoirs, 'History and hearsay.' It teleports players to the Graveyard of Heroes south-west of the Shayzien bank.
Ability to fight the Corrupt Lizardman in the Nightmare Zone.

title: Tears of Guthix
reward: Ability to play the Tears of Guthix (minigame) once a week

title: Temple of Ikov
reward: Armadyl pendant (if you sided with Lucien, you must kill Guardians of Armadyl to obtain it)
Pendant of Lucien, which grants access to a door in the Temple of Ikov
Optional; Shiny key, for a shortcut between the Temple of Ikov and McGrubor's Wood
Completing this quest awards the player with 5 kudos which can be claimed by talking to Historian Minas in the Varrock Museum

title: Throne of Miscellania
required-skills: It's an advantage to have either Level 35 herblore or Level 45 woodcutting to earn approval.
reward: The ability to teleport to Miscellania using a ring of wealth.

title: The Tourist Trap
required-skills: Be able to kill a level 47 Mercenary Captain.
reward: 4,650 Experience in your choice of two skills (you may pick same skill twice): Agility, Fletching, Smithing, or Thieving.
The wrought iron key - allows access to a special door inside the Desert Mining Camp, which has several higher tier ores inside, including mithril ore and adamantite ore.

title: Tree Gnome Village
required-skills: Be able to kill a Level 112 Khazard warlord.
reward: Use of spirit trees for transportation

title: Troll Romance
required-skills: The ability to defeat a level 171 Troll.
reward: A sled (required to complete a hard and an elite clue scroll step)

title: Troll Stronghold
required-skills: The ability to defeat a level 113 Troll General (can be safespotted).
reward: Law talisman (if you lose it, you can get another from Dunstan for 1000 coins)
Access to Trollheim and the Troll Stronghold (location)
Ability to access the God Wars Dungeon

title: Underground Pass
required-skills: Good Agility and Thieving Skills (Level 50+ Recommended)
Be able to kill three level 91 demons.
reward: Iban's staff and use of the Iban Blast spell

title: Wanted!
reward: Access to the armoury of the White Knights (White equipment)

title: Watchtower
required-skills: The ability to kill a Level 68 Ogre.
reward: A scroll, the reading of which gives you the ability to use Watchtower Teleport
Access to the ogre city (and Ogre Enclave where you can fight blue dragons. You will not need an extra nightshade to enter after the quest is complete.)

title: What Lies Below
reward: Access to a shortcut to the chaos altar
Completing this quest awards the player with 5 Kudos which can be claimed by talking to Historian Minas in the Varrock Museum, while holding the Dagon'hai history book.

title: X Marks the Spot
reward: Antique lamp providing 300 experience in a skill of the player's choosing (can be reclaimed if lost or destroyed).
A beginner clue scroll (only if the player does not have one already in their possession; can be claimed later if players had one in their possession already)

title: Zogre Flesh Eaters
required-skills: It's recommended to have a Level 20+ Strength
reward: Ability to fletch Comp ogre bows and Brutal arrows
Give a 2 or 3 or 4 dose Relicym's balm to Uglug to gain access to ~ Uglug's stuffsies ~
